alert.note: Alert for Coastal Chatham (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 09 at 11:57AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...WINDS INCREASING ALONG THE COAST... ...HIGH WIND WARNING CONTINUES... Winds will continue to strengthen across the coastal counties through the afternoon. Trees have been reported blown down in many areas since sunrise and additional wind damage is likely. Wind gusts in excess of 50 mph have been common this morning and the risk for gusts near 60 mph will steadily increase through the afternoon. Power outages are likely. Even stronger winds could occur on elevated bridges such as the the Ravenel Bridge, the Don Holt Bridge, the James B. Edwards Bridge, the Ben Sawyer Bridge, the Isle of Palms Connector, the Amos Nathaniel Rodgers Bridge, the McKinley Washington Junior Bridge and the Woods Memorial Bridge. Dangerous driving conditions are likely on these bridges. Heed any potential bridge closures or warnings from local officials. A line of strong to severe thunderstorms will move across the coast later this afternoon. Be prepared to take immediate action should Severe Thunderstorm or Tornado Warnings be issued for your area. A Tornado Watch is in effect through 6 PM.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio All Hazards or the Internet for the latest information from the National Weather Service.
